topics.body:
You know I thought of something kind of funny; internet memes in of themselves are kind of funny for existing cause advertisers don't know what the hell they are doing with them because by the time bs marketing like this-
!http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/889/983/752.png!
-comes out the memes are already massively outdated so it leaves advertisers scrambling trying to keep up.  It's like that episode of Ed, Edd 'N Eddy called "Fad Freaky"; mainstream culture is trying to keep up to the internet and they can't keep up cause the two are incompatible.  I totally agree that stuff like that is metaphorical internet cancer, but it's the funny kind where the person responsible is like that person that goes "<insert your name> let's go bounce out of this joint and grab a wicked soda.  Don't like soda?  Bummer" cause they don't understand that no longer talk like that it's funny watching them try to keep up.

topics.body: It's the third time I have to return a PSP to CeX because it doesn't work...they refuse to give me a refund so I have to just keep turning it in for a new one every single time! Doesn't matter how many times I test it in store, something unforeseen always happens. Seriously,  I'm sick of buying games from them; they always end up being cursed in one way or another. If I get a working game, I end up losing it. And of course, this entire PSP nonsense.
